description.narrative: Detta är ett fas II stöd till Health Economics and AIDS Research Divisions (HEARD), Durban, Sydafrika, forskningsstrategi 2011-2015. Kunskap och evidens för påverkan: Integrera hiv-arbete med mänsklig utveckling. Det övergripande målet är: att bidra till produktion av kunskap och utnyttjande av kunskap och evidens som stödjer att integration av hälsa, hiv och mänsklig utveckling i östra och södra A

Phase II support to HEARDs strategy 2011- 2015 Knowledge and Evidence for Impact: Integrating HIV Response with Human Development. The overall goal is: to contribute to the production of knowledge and utilisation of knowledge and evidence which support integrating health, HIV and human development responses in East and Southern Africa.

"Contribute to the production of knowledge and utilization of knowledge and evidence which support integrating health, HIV and human development responses in East and Southern Africa" (tentative new overall objective: "To achieve health equity across the continent by meeting Africa's health challenges of today and tomorrow")

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: During the project period, HEARD has delivered results in the following areas i) conducting and disseminating interdisciplinary research on HIV and AIDS, ii) public health education and training, iii) creating and leading a robust network of partners and iv) provide evidence driven technical assistance to support governments to address critical health priorities. In total 85 research projects were undertaken, both commissioned work and HEARD initiated research projects. In terms of publications, which is a key output for research organizations, HEARD published 206 journal articles, books and book chapters. In addition 44 briefs (policy/meeting), 24 research reports and 3 manuals and toolkits. During the project period, HEARD has established a scholarship PhD programme with regional uptake, one of the few of its kind on the continent. 29 scholarships have been awarded and 18 students have been awarded their doctorate degree so far. Students from 15 different countries have received scholarships. In order to remain relevant to the regional health agenda, HEARD has repositioned itself over the last few years. This has included broadening its focus from HIV/AIDS to include other pressing health challenges within sexual and reproductive health.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
